text:
65 man with no prior signif history. 5 days nausea, vomiting, cough.
   Called allergist who gave him benzonatate and Ab which he did not take.
   Nausea worsened and he developed dry heaves. Cough was productive of
   [**Location (un) **] secretions. Went to ED yesterday with increased SOB. Had RUL
   infiltrate, wheezes. Given Levoflox, pred 50 and percocet and
   discharged home. Overnight yesterday, SOB worsened and repeated na
   usea, vomiting. Returned to [**Location 73**] where CXR noted to be worse with fever
   102.4 with elevated BP at 206/136, pulse 119, 89% sat on RA.
   Vanco/Zosyn and fluid boluses. Albuterol nebs, zofran, compazine and
   admitted to MICU. After admit, worsening oxygenation, breathing rapidly
   and intubated. After intubation ABG was 7.16/74/42. This improved over
   first 1/2 hr to current sat's of 90-94% on 100% with 15 PEEP.
   Events: pt admitted fromED on NRB with sat 86-87%, discussed with pt
   and pt
s wife intubation. [**Name2 (NI) **] anesthesia and pt was intubated , but
   was difficulty oxygenation with sat 64-68, start on fentanyl/versed
   gtt, required multiple boluses of sedation and high dose of sedation to
   keep pt not to OVB vent and bring sat up to 88%, multiple ABG
   sent.,start onPropofol, dropped BP to 80
s, given fluid bolus
   Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS, Acute Lung Injury, [**Doctor Last Name 11**])
   Assessment:
   Pt intubated on AC,LS rhonchi, suction copous amount bloody frothy
   secretion( possible pt aspirated). Pt is difficult to oxygenate, while
   lighling on sedation pt start OVB vent and desat to 82=83, sedation up
   bp dropped to 81-82.attempt to stopped Versed/fentany unsuccessful d/t
   desat to low 80
   Action:
   Bronch done no significant . cont sedation to keep sat 89-91%
   Response:
   While upon sedation sat up to 89-90%, pt appears more comfortable, but
   BP down to 80, lactate 1.6
   Plan:
   Start Cisatracuriom, stopped propofol, cont fentanyl/versed, cont
   follow ABG
   Hypotension (not Shock)
   Assessment:
   After start propofol pt dropped BP to 80.
   Action:
   Given fluids bolus,light on sedation.
   Response:
   BP up to 100
s-120
s, but pt became unsynchronized with vent,sedation
   up, given fluid bolus
   Plan:
   Put centrakl line, start pressors, give fluid

info.concept: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease of horses
